event.title: began as a mining community in the early 1900s

data.event: Franklin began as a mining community in the early 1900s.
The first post office in Franklin was established in 1908.

event.title: May 4, 2003, a high-end F4 tornado ripped

data.event: On May 4, 2003, a high-end F4 tornado ripped through Franklin, the path reached over 0.5 miles (0.80 km) wide at points.

Miners Hall Museum Opened on May 1, 2012, the Minerâ€™s Hall Museum was established to preserve and present authentic materials and artifacts that document the history of coal mining and its impact on Southeast Kansas, as well as to be a vital partner in the educational and cultural life of Southeast Kansas through its collections and programs.
